intro: Riedelia geluensis var. geluensis, commonly known as the Geluensian riedelia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments and is valued for its ornamental appeal. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
